result.execSummary:
The defendant Joanne E Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Any bond posted in these matters is to be applied to the costs and surcharge.
Obtain Mental Health Assessment if deemed appropriate and comply.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs and controlled substances to the effect that she should not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
No contact with Bruce Vossekuil without her agents consent.

Provide agent with list of all medications she is prescribed. 
Only use 1 pharmacy to obtain medications and sign necessary releases so the agent can monitor. 
Participate in any other counseling and assessment deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Allowed to transfer probation to her county of residence which is Waushara County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joanne E Sullivan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joanne E Sullivan in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the Portage County.  
8:37 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 
All files heard: 15CM301, 15CM305, 15FO347, 15FO348

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Drengler makes statements re: entering a plea to both the obstructing charges rather than the drug paraphernalia.  
(Parties discuss the matter off the record).
Atty Constable makes statements.  Does not recall the discussion they had, but will depend on his recollection and does not have a problem with proceeding to plea in 15CM301 Count 1 as well as 15CM305 Count 1 and dismissing and read-in 15CM305 Count 2. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM301 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CM305 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15FO347 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM301 Count 1, 15CM305 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.
Court finds the defendant guilty 15FO347.

15CM305 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 
15FO348 is dismissed outright. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Constable. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
15CM301 Count 1 - 
Serve 10 days jail with huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 1 year: 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regard to alcohol and illegal drugs and controlled substances to the effect that she should not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Provide agent with list of all medications she is prescribed.
Only use 1 pharmacy to obtain medications and sign necessary releases so the agent can monitor.
Obtain mental health assessment if deemed appropriate and comply. 
Participate in any other counseling and assessment deemed appropriate by the agent. 
No contact with Bruce Vossekuil without her agents consent. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Any bond posted in these matters be applied to the costs and surcharges. 
Allowed to transfer probation to her county of residence which is Waushara County. 

15CM305 Count 1 -
Serve 30 days jail with huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Due to the nature of the offense and the length of the jail imposed and stayed, Court does not grant home monitoring program.  STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months concurrent with 15CM301: 
Same conditions as ordered in 15CM301. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Any bond posted in these matters be applied to the costs and surcharges. 
Allowed to transfer probation to her county of residence which is Waushara County. 

15FO347 - 
Pay forfeiture of $263.50.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: $500 cash bond already posted.  Comply with conditions on 15CM305.

Defendant Joanne E Sullivan in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM301, 15CM305, 15FO347, and 15FO348.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered on all case heard today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: and Cash Bond Posted in amount of $500 15R 044852
